column1: - Most women receive general anesthesia for this surgery.
The surgeon may perform this surgery using an endoscope.

Risks of anesthesia and surgery in general are: - Reactions to medicines, breathing problems - Bleeding, blood clots, infection Risks of breast surgery are: - Difficulty breastfeeding - Loss of feeling in the nipple area - Small scars, usually in an area where they do not show much - Thickened, raised scars - Uneven position of nipples - Different sizes or shapes of the two breasts - Breaking or leakage of the implant - Visible rippling of the implant - Need for more breast surgery It is normal for your body to create a "capsule" made up of scar tissue around your new breast implant.
- Several days before surgery, you may be asked to stop taking aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), warfarin (Coumadin), and any other medicines that make it hard for your blood to clot.
